data.title: The perfect place for breakfast.
data.text: CoCo"s has been in Simi Valley for as long as I can remember, & it is the perfect place for a good breakfast. They have all the traditional breakfast choices you can think of & some. The quality of their food is excellent & the service is prompt & courteous. At this visit we met up with several of our friends that we have not seen in years & had lots to talk about. The staff did not give us any feeling that we were overstaying our time at the table on the contrary they were most friendly. The food portions are quite large to the point I don't think any of us eat all our breakfasts. I do not know if they still do but years ago they always opened on Christmas day which was both rare & convenient should you not have a place to go & you did not want to cook. Although not claiming to be fine dinning it is an excellent place to enjoy a home type cooked meal & is very clean & comfortable.

data.title: This place brings back good memories.
data.text: I enjoyed going to Coco's with my family as a kid growing up in the SFV. The food may not be the same as I remember it, but the place still has a nice feel to it and it's a great place to get a slice of pie and a good cup of coffee.

data.title: recognised the name ; just what you expect from 'COCO'S'
data.text: we tried this place as we just wanted a simple meal and knew of the 'Coco' chain of old and this was a typical place. Again there seemed to be an element of repeat clientele so it was obviously a local rated place. Again a good choice on the menu and the food ,when it arrived (no it didnt take much time) was just what we wanted. definately on our 'go back' list now that we have discovered it - slightly out of the way location.

data.title: Creepy
data.text: Table was oddly cramped and the place smelled of dirty mop water.  The waiter could not even finishing putting drinks on the table before wandering off in a daze.  He kept flirting with my 13 year old and she asked if we could never come back.  What a weird nightmare.

data.title: Alway enjoy going
data.text: Food is good, especially the pies and the service is alway friendly and good.  Is usually crowded at dinner.

data.title: Large group of 14 for a Birthday...
data.text:
Average food, average service, nice restaurant but nothing to get thrilled about.
Had to ask for coffee refills, nothing ever cleaned up from table until we were finished.
We had even called the day before to let them know we were coming..

data.title: Amazing Dutch Apple Pie
data.text: Sweet little place that takes you back in time. The Dutch Apple Pie is the one against which to judge all others. Get it! The chicken salads were pretty good.

data.title: Great Bakery
data.text: My mother in law took us here for lunch during our visit to Simi Valley.  While I really enjoyed the apple pie (it was delicious!!), I was really not impressed with the food or service.  I ordered a turkey croissant, and it was very dry. After our food was delivered, the waiter never came back to the table.  We had to stop someone else to get us new drinks and anything else we needed.  At the time we were in there, there were only two other tables.  My husband had a burger, and he said it was also dry and didn't really have any flavor.  If we visit again, I would try the breakfast.

data.title: Best cinnamon roll French toast ever!
data.text: This is the place to go to when you're in the mood for a great breakfast. Very fast, friendly service. Prices are very cheap compared to the amount of food you get. The cinnamon roll French toast is my favorite breakfast item there. Their potatoes are delicious as well. You cannot go wrong with any of their meals! Would definitely go back!!!

data.title: Great staff - but the vegetables are not as fresh as they had been.
data.text:
Pro
1 Great staff who go above and beyond to make your dining time a pleasure. They are friendly and helpful.
2. The addition of more healthy foods is good for those who are watching what they eat. 
3. Plenty of parking at this location.

Con
1. Lately the quality of vegetables has declined.
2. The new manager seems to lack customer skills.
3.Lately they have been short staffed during peak hours. This could be an issue with the new manager. 

A little attitude adjustment by the manager and better fresh vegetables would earn them another star.

data.title: service was better than average
data.text: standard coco's food but waiter was not only helpful with ordering but with follow through  was impressed
